text: Liberty University is a private, Christian university in Lynchburg, Virginia. The university has about 69,214 students. It was founded in 1971 by Jerry Falwell.About Liberty The current chancellor of the university is Jonathan Falwell (the son of Jerry Falwell). ==Sports== The athletics teams of the university are called the Flames (men) and Lady Flames (women). They have 18 varsity teams, most of which compete in Conference USA (CUSA). Three teams in sports that CUSA does not sponsor play elsewhere. Women's lacrosse plays in the Big East Conference, men's soccer in the Ohio Valley Conference, and women's swimming & diving in the Atlantic Sun Conference. ==References== ==Other websites== *Liberty University's Official website *Liberty Flames' Official athletics website Category:Colleges and universities in Virginia Category:Christian colleges and universities in the United States Category:Conference USA Category:1971 establishments in the United States Category:1970s establishments in Virginia
title: Liberty University
